fields.headline: Threat to Ellis' big day
fields.bodyText: The former Great Britain wing St John Ellis, now in charge of Doncaster, may be banished to the stands on the biggest day of his coaching career. Ellis was sent off in Sunday's Northern Ford Premiership win over Swinton and may be banned for the visit to his former club Castleford in the Challenge Cup quarter-final. His Rugby Football League hearing is on Thursday. Simon Haughton, Wigan's former Great Britain second-row, has been summoned to appear at a disciplinary hearing today after being put on report for a forearm smash on Bradford's Brandon Costin in Friday night's Super League opener. The Hull Kingston Rovers prop John Aston spent the weekend in intensive care after being attacked last Friday night while returning from a club event. His condition is now described as stable but he faces a long absence from the game. · You've read the piece, now have your say.
